intro: Melampyrum pratense f. albido-sulfureum, commonly known as the sulphur yellow touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is known for its parasitic nature, drawing nutrients from the roots of other plants. The leaves are usually lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem. The flower cluster, known as a scorpioid cyme, consists of numerous small, bright yellow-orange blooms. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and meadows.
